caption: This Place is very nice. The food is different, delicious and wholesome. The food is Oklahoma inspired. They have this amazing Tomato Soup and Crab Cake Sliders, Ummh Ummh Delish. I love ordering different sides instead of the whole meal. Please go you wont regret it.
The food and customer service were great! I really enjoyed the sliders and lemonade. The red velvet is the best
BBQ is tasty with loads of choices, friendly staff
The mac and cheese is quite possibly the best mac and cheese i have ever had. Their pulled pork and stuffing also great, the Tres Leches cake is truly amazing, i dream about it most nights.

This place has really good barbecue and the service is excellent and friendly.  My family has made the 30-block walk to eat here three times in the past two weeks.  The ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken are all outstanding.  The kids love the hot dogs, Mac and cheese, and cornbread, in addition to the traditional bbq meats.  Highly recommend!
We had a superb experience at this spot. We enjoyed the wonderful ambience and the meals. The staff members are very affable. I’m content we eventually managed to visit here.

I have been going to this restaurant since it opened and the quality of their barbecue is always the best. I love steak sandwiches and pork chops. They are so good! You can taste the quality of the meat is very good. The service staff is also very warm, every time to feel very cordial! It is highly recommended!!!!
Amazing! And the bakery products are outstanding!
This place is excellent! Good rates, large portions and the staff members are always very friendly.
The food and service were above my expectations. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Nice restaurant to take my family out for lunch.

The girls that work there are all sweet and friendly. Price is cheaper than other bbq place especially for the beef short ribs. But! 5 out of 10 times ordering the beef short ribs by the pound, I swear half pound of it comes in the form of fat. Its so fatty! I dont understand why they didnt use the fatty part for the platter options where they sliced up the ribs so they can discard the fat. Today I got the most fatty beef short ribs of all time and ruin my dining experience. Its inedible and when I tried to separate the meat and the congeal fat, the liquid fat were dripping all over my table. I would go again though, cause its just around the corner of my house and with the pandemic, it is very convenient.
WE LOVE THEIR MAC. ALL OF THEIR BBQ SAUCES ARE GREAT. MUSHROOM PLATTER IS TASTY
Love the food and my husband gets his food there every week! We get the Mac & Cheese and Frito pie and desserts are delicious too!
This spot simply knows how to treat their clients. Regularly with a nice demeanor. The food is conveniently priced, regularly fresh and clean.
(Translated by Google) The best rib in the country  (Original) La mejor costilla del pais
The food and service were beyond my expectations. We surely loved the atmosphere of this spot. Nice spot to take the family out for lunch.
Food tastes as good as homemade

This place is great! I have only done take out thus far so I can't speak to what the dine in experience will be like (post COVID). The ribs and the brisket are phenomenal. The sauces are a perfect match and they have several to choose from. I actually like to mix them. The Fritos Chili is a great side. The value is really high especially when compared with the local competition. In my opinion, you're getting a superior product for considerably less money!
This spot is worth trying. They serve big portions for fair rates. Regularly clean and with excellent character. Will come visit again.
Very gratious hosts, quick delivery. Brisket melts like butter. Ribs a bit dry, but sauce made up for it.
Best ribs I have ever have, and their soups are really good. Support these guys during this trying time!
They are so nice and fast and the food is perfect every time
This spot never fails to impress. They have awesome food for reasonable pricing, there are no long waits even when the place is full.
Real BBQ, Smoked meats at a fair price. Food isn't very warm though, kinda room temperature, if that doesnt bother you this place is golden

Food was delicious! Had beef rib and a brisket slider. No complaints at all about the food. And I would go back for that reason.  The main reason behind a less than excellent rating is due to the actual process of getting the food. I understand it’s take out only at this time but there is absolutely no process in place to manage efficient and seamless pick up. There is a tony shelf for ready food and no clear identifier what item is for what order. The hostess was being super nice but it seemed chaotic on people ordering, phoning, sorting out orders and knowing even when the order is ready? One man in the line got so frustrated he walked out and didn’t order. No one even knew where to stand and one lady was not happy being close to someone near her.  I hope this feedback is helpful to find a better system as the current one will turn customers away. And the food is good to come back for.
Very pleased with this addition to the neighborhood as they offer some variety to the usual offerings around here.  Our sandwiches were tasty and the staff was pleasant.

It is unfortunate the UWS finally gets an authentic BBQ spot during the current pandemic.   At any other  time,  there would be so much more interest in checking this place out.    That being said,  I stopped in for lunch last week to support this fairly new establishment.    The restaurant had just opened,  and there was a small crowd eagerly waiting to order.     Good menu,  and quite reasonably priced.  I ordered the half rack of ribs,  and the brisket platter with mac and cheese,  and baked beans.       The meat was perfectly smoked and mac and cheese was good.   But the absolute winner was the baked beans!!     Sweet and smoky,  with great flavor and perfectly cooked beans.     The brisket was flavorful and moist,  but more crumbled than sliced.   The one downfall was the BBQ sauce,  which is thankfully offered on the side.       It tasted more like the base of a pot of chili than anything else.   Was not good and completely ruined the great smoke flavor of the meat!        And I was not offered bread (I had to ask),  which is a staple at most BBQ restaurants.    But, with time,  both are easily remedied.     The staff was friendly  and courteous,  and I will definitely be back.      I truly wish this place success,  as it is much needed in the neighborhood.
I was looking forward to trying their "sage-raisin stuffing". What a joke. No sage, no raisins. Boring, bland, dry. Supermarket kitchens make better stuffing. Bye-bye Au Jus.
Great Southern BBQ spot. Delicious take out. Will support this restaurant often during the Rona crises

A new restaurant called Au Jus is opening on Broadway and 99th in the spring of 2020, according to a sign on the door. There are other Au Jus locations on the Upper East Side, in Harlem and in Brooklyn. It’s an Oklahoma barbecue joint, that it’s pretty authentic. “We prepare delicious comfort foods – luscious roasted meats and chicken to be sure – plus soups, salads, sandwiches, sides, and desserts,” the restaurant says. See other locations for the menu.
